TopicTitle: How will you approach the new tutorial animations?

Articles.Content:
First forum topic in a while, so I hope you will bear with me.

I was perusing this sub-forum, and saw a topic that inspired me to create this poll. So, I am curious: how will you be approaching the new tutorial animations planned for KSP2? Personally, I am not a new player of KSP by any means, but I will likely be watching the animations for late game content, as well as to support the efforts that the devs put into them. I want to know how you guys feel!

Also, mods, feel free to do what you need to this topic. Again, I am not exactly used to posting topics on the forums, so I apologize in advance for any errors I have made.
The other i mean, is that i am good at ksp and can make an orbit but am unable to go  to the mun or further. The old tutorials sucked, so the new ones should help.
Yes, I am not new, but I like the animations and I might learn something new anyway.
The animations look funny
Probably will mess something up and end up watching the tutorial for the fun of it.

Yeah, I'm interested to see the tutorials anyway, even though I already have a good grasp on the first game.

And in the event parts of the game are different enough that I would need to relearn them, watching the tutorials right at the beginning removes the possibility of coming in all arrogant and then having to shamefully go check the tutorials after numerous failures.
I want to see if they can train a kindergartener  to conduct an orbital rendezvous using cartoons.

28 minutes ago, TLTay said:

I want to see if they can train a kindergartener  to conduct an orbital rendezvous using cartoons. 

I'm sure someone will take on that challenge.
I'll watch them if only to find out once and for all what all the new buttons in the VAB do
Watch them all because the look so cool and to figure out late game mechanics

I kinda hope the animations get released before the game, as a sort of 'Preview Playlist'.

For that matter, the tutorials would be good as a Demo. I'd go for that big time.
not going to bother. I am going to do it like I do with all games. Play it for 4000 hours and then find out ive missed some shortcut or trick that would have made my life 100 times easier.
I was you I saw youtubers with a burn indicator which tells you what time until burn. I figured it out this year when I could of checked the settings and sawn it

On 4/4/2022 at 9:08 PM, TLTay said:

I want to see if they can train a kindergartener  to conduct an orbital rendezvous using cartoons. 

I no longer have access to a kindergartener. However I did coax my pre-teen daughter into orbit and return for a class project. I'll be impressed. It's not easy to explain this game without making their eyes glaze over. I had the advantage in that my kid has my sense of humour.

On 5/3/2022 at 5:40 PM, obnox twin said:

Watch them all

Me too.
@KSACheeseI'm curious,  how would watching the tutorials 'support the developers'?

6 hours ago, pandaman said:

@KSACheeseI'm curious,  how would watching the tutorials 'support the developers'?

By this, I just mean “support the effort they put into it”. For instance, I probably wont need the tutorials (except maybe for the newest content) but I still want to support the effort they put into making them. Hope that helps.  

Edited May 6, 2022 by KSACheese

On 4/4/2022 at 2:50 PM, Catto said:

he other i mean, is that i am good at ksp and can make an orbit but am unable to go  to the mun or furthe

same

On 4/5/2022 at 4:50 AM, Catto said:

The other i mean, is that i am good at ksp and can make an orbit but am unable to go  to the mun or further. The old tutorials sucked, so the new ones should help.

Lets face if you are still going to push to limits as you get better and tutorials trigger based on failure then I'll probably still see all of them anyway and take a moment to enjoy.
I'm experienced in KSP, but i want to watch the tutorials for entertainment value. Also, interstellar travel
